'detailed representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a detailed representation of the object;
'idealized representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a simplified representation of the object, e.g., for analysis purposes.
For analysis purposes an 'idealized representation' that is not fully detailed in every respect may be sufficient and be preferable due to less overhead implied by its usage.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A ShapeElement is a portion of shape that has to be identified explicitly to be associated with other information.
A ShapeElement may be a .
ShapeElement objects can be classified using .
In order to identify a portion of one face of a shaft that shall have a surface coating applied to it, ShapeElement is used.
An example for classifying ShapeElement objects is to identify all parts of an air plane that constitute the outer surface of the plane and are therefore relevant for aerodynamic analyses.
The threaded portion of the shape of a bolt may be represented as a ShapeElement, so that other properties, such as surface finish, may be associated with it.

object references 'left wheel' as related instance, 'rear axle' as 'upper usage', and 'chassis' as assemblyContext.
The

A StandardUncertainty is a type of . A StandardUncertainty may be an ExpandedUncertainty. The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
specifies a REAL value of the uncertainty.
A StockMaterial is the material typically procured from a material supplier to fabricate a Part.
The StockMaterial in this Part of 10303 is limited to the material types that physically become all or a portion of the finished part.
the identifier or set of identifiers for the StockMaterial.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the words or set of words by which the StockMaterial is known.
This attribute supports multiple names in different contexts as well as multi linguism.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the StockMaterial.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification or set of identifications of a particular version of the StockMaterial.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
specifies the material type for the StockMaterial. A StockMaterial may be either a AnisotropicMaterial or a BraidedAssembly, or a DiscontinuousFiberAssembly, or a FilamentAssembly, or a IsotropicMaterial, or a StockCore, or a WovenAssembly.
specifies the that defines the behavior of the StockMaterial to an external response.
specifies the direction for the StockMaterial such as cell direction, grain direction, etc. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A StringValue is a type of
that represents a sequence of one or more alphanumeric characters.
specifies the string represented by the StringValue.
A StyledModel is a type of
that defines the stub for a set of geometric or annotation elements for which visual characteristics are specified. The geometric or annotation elements are defined in a .
the identifier or set of identifiers for the StyledModel.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the type of the StyledModel. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'styled geometric model': the referenced contains geometric elements that have presentation information;
'styled annotation model': the referenced contains annotation elements.
the in which the styled geometric or annotation elements are defined.
A SubsetMember is a relationship that is between set A, and set B that indicates: each member of set A is also a member of set B.
Set A may be equal to set B.
the set that contains only members of superset.
the set that contains only members of superset.
A SuppliedObjectRelationship is a relationship between two objects of the list representing the same object in different organizational contexts. The different organizational contexts can be represented by different s.
The concept of multi identification may also be used to distinguish objects in different organizational contexts. However, SuppliedObjectRelationship shall be used if the related object corresponds to an object at the supplier's site and if a distinction of additional information such as name or organizational information is needed.
Usually, s that are provided by suppliers have at the supplier's site an id different from the one at the contractor's site: a that is identified in a company by the identifier 'C425' and the version id 'V2.0' may correspond to the that the supplier identifies as '2X45' with the version id 'V3.2'.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the SuppliedObjectRelationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the SuppliedObjectRelationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
one object of that is part of the relationship.
the other object of that is part of the relationship.
the related and the relating object shall be of same type.
A SupplierSolution is a type of that is an alternative solution provided by a particular supplier. The 'tyre' has a of '225x50 VR17' with suppliers A, B, or C.
A SupplierSolution is associated with each of these suppliers.
the share that is assigned to the supplier in the context of the inherited attribute . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that acts as supplier for the SupplierSolution.
A SurfaceCondition is a definition of a characteristic or property of a surface of a part.
the identifier or set of identifiers for the SurfaceCondition.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the or for which a SurfaceCondition is provided.
the type of the SurfaceCondition. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'contact ratio': the SurfaceCondition specifies the measure of the quality of contact of a shape on a reference surface;
'hardness': the SurfaceCondition defines the hardness of a material on its surface. The hardness represents the resistance of a surface to deformation by external forces;
'tactile appearance': the SurfaceCondition specifies the appearance of a surface of a part regarding the sense of touch;
'treatment result': the SurfaceCondition is a result of a certain treatment;
'visual appearance': the SurfaceCondition specifies the appearance of a surface of a part regarding the optical impression;
'surface texture': the SurfaceCondition characterizes of irregularities of the surface of a shape or of a portion of a shape. Such an irregularity has a negligible impact on its dimensions but may impact some of its mechanical or functional characteristics.
the in which the details of the SurfaceCondition are defined.
A SurfaceWithDirection is the specification of a surface and a direction. The surface shall be one of the entities. The defines the side of the Surface that is the material side.
specifies the that is used in the definition.
specifies the side of the definingSurface that is the material side.
A woven fabric will have both a warp and fill directions. The materialDirection shall identify the warp direction for orientation in the laminate. The materialDirection for a honeycomb core shall be that of ribbon direction.
A SystemBreakdown is a type of
that identifies a partitioning of a product into a structured set of objects that are classified to be system objects. A SystemBreakdown is a view of the systems of a product by means of parent-child relationships. Not all systems of the product need to be included in a SystemBreakdown.
A SystemBreakdown provides a decomposition of an aircraft in terms of high-level systems, such as 'fuel system' or 'flight control system'; the second example may further decompose into low-level systems such as 'autopilot system' and 'instrument landing system'.
Parent-child relationships are represented by objects.
the inherited attribute . The value of breakdownType shall be 'system'.
A TechnicalSolution is a type of
that is an alternative solution where the functional requirements are fulfilled in a certain technical way. 'disc brake', 'disc brake ventilated' and 'disc brake with ABS' are examples of TechnicalSolution objects for
'front left brake'.
A TemplateDefinition is a replica of a or of a .
the set of object that uses the same TemplateDefinition object as their definition.
A TemplateInstance is a replica of a . The location of the replica and any additional geometrical transformation to be applied to the replica, i.e., uniform scaling, rotation or mirroring, are specified by the attributes 'origin' and 'target'.
In the case where the units of the Cartesian coordinate space of the definition are different from the units to be applied to the TemplateInstance, unit conversion is required.
In case of length unit conversion this conversion applies in addition to the scale attribute.
In a technical drawing of a mechanical part with several identical drilling holes, the hole geometry (circle) together with its annotation elements (diameter dimension and centrelines) is defined once. This particular definition is instantiated several times at different locations by corresponding TemplateInstance objects.
A TemplateInstance is a type of .
the identifier or set of identifiers for the TemplateInstance.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in .
the words or set of words by which the TemplateInstance is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multiple names in different contexts as well as multi linguism.
the object to be replicated.
the
that defines the origin of the replicated object.
the scaling factor for all Cartesian coordinate directions. The scaling factor shall be positive. If the scaling factor is omitted, it shall be 1.0. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the geometrical transformation applied to the instance. All transformations that can be expressed by an orthonormal 2 x 2 (for 2D) or 3 x 3 (for 3D) matrix can be applied.
Examples for suitable operations are rotation and mirroring.
A ThicknessLaminateTable is a type of that is used to capture the ordered list of constituents that make up a zone.
specifies the ordered list of entities that make up the zone. There shall exist not less than two for the ThicknessLaminateTable.
A ThicknessSizeDimension is the physical thickness of a . The remaining thickness below a blind hole might be specified as a ThicknessSizeDimension.
The thickness of a
is a ThicknessSizeDimension.
the identifier or set of identifiers for the ThicknessSizeDimension.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the that is of the specified thickness.
the that describes value and unit of the thickness.
A ThreeDGeometrySet is a type of that defines 3D boundary curve and surface geometry without topology. The surfaces used in the representation have a defined model surface context.
specifies the context of the basis surface for the part. 'layup surface', 'outer mold line', and 'inner mold line' are specific contexts.
specifies the Surface used to define the part shape. The context of the surface is defined in the attribute basisRole.
specifies the set of Curve objects that define the edge aspect of a part.
represents the fact that a ThreeDGeometrySet is an .
A TimeInterval is the specification of a unit of time.
the identifier or set of identifiers for the TimeInterval.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

defines the end of the TimeInterval, either by referring to a bound, or specifying the extend of the TimeInterval by a . If the endDefinition refers to an or , this particular bound of the resulting interval is excluded from it.
defines the beginning of the TimeInterval. The bound specified by the startDefinition is included in the resulting interval.

Such information is conveyed using , , and respectively.

the meaning of the assignment/association.
Where applicable, the following values shall be used:
'installation': The assignment specifies that the object referenced as assignedTo was mounted in a product during the given interval of time;
specifies the that is associated with the product data.
specifies the set of objects of product data with which the TimeIntervalAssignment is assigned.

A ToolPartRelationship is a type of
that is a relationship between two objects. It establishes a relationship between a part ( ) and a tool (
) that is used to produce the part.
This relationship is, by default, valid only in the application contexts that are relevant for both
objects.
specifies the relative position of the Item representing the part with respect to the local coordinate system of the Item representing the tool. In the case where the placement is realized by a , the scale factor of that
shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the inherited attribute relationType. The value of relationType shall be 'tool part'.

An UncertaintyQualifier is a qualifier that specifies an uncertainty as defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the UncertaintyQualifier.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words or set of words by which the UncertaintyQualifier is known. This attribute supports multiple names in different contexts as well as multi linguism.
the proxies of the UncertaintyQualifier.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Unit is a quantity chosen as a standard in terms of which other quantities may be expressed. The types of units supported by this standard are SI units as well as derived or conversion based units as defined in ISO 10303-41.
the words or set of words by which the Unit is known. This attribute supports multiple names in different contexts as well as multi linguism.
specifies the system in which the Unit is defined. Where applicable the following value shall be used: 'SI system'. 'SI system'
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the specification of the ratio with the unit specified by the name. Where applicable the following values shall be used: exa, peta, tera, giga, mega, kilo, hecto, deca, deci, centi, milli, micro, nano, pico, femto, atto.
'milli' specifies that the unit is 0.001 times the unit specifed by the name.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the type of property that the Unit shall be used for. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The unit 'metre' is used to measure quantities of type 'length'.
A ValueLimit is a type of
with a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular physical characteristic. '30.5 max' and '5 min' are examples for a ValueLimit.
specifies the kind of the limit. The following values shall be used:
'maximum': The specified limit is an upper limit;
'minimum': The specified limit is a lower limit.
A ValueList is a type of
with an ordered collection of objects.
A may be composed of different property values such as 'mass', 'speed', and 'age' which are altogether necessary in a given context. The ValueList collects all of them in a given order, such that each is identifiable by its index in the list.
specifies the ordered collection of objects that together are provided as a .
A ValueRange is a type of
with a pair of numerical values representing the range in which the value shall lie.
specifies the minimum acceptable value that is constrained by the ValueRange.
specifies the maximum acceptable value that is constrained by the ValueRange.
A ValueSet is a type of
with an unordered collection of objects.
specifies the unordered collection of objects that together are provided as a .
A ValueWithTolerances is a type of
that specifies a range of values by specifying a single nominal value and two tolerances that are offsets from the single value. The range is defined to be the closed interval [tolerancedValue + lowerLimit, tolerancedValue + upperLimit].
the lower limit of the range.
the single value that is the base value for specifying the range.
the upper limit of the rhange.
A ValueWithUnit is a type of
with either a single numerical measure, or a range of numerical measures with upper, lower, or upper and lower bounds.
specifies the number of decimal digits that are relevant for the use of the ValueWithUnit. If present, the numerical measure or range may be specified using more digits than the significant digits but shall not be specified using less digits. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the unit in which the ValueWithUnit is expressed.
A ViewContext is a grouping of an application domain and a life cycle stage. It identifies a universe of discourse suitable for the description of parts.
Requirements and vocabularies vary among the industrial activity fields. This entity intends to identify such domains.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the ViewContext.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of the applications for which an object may be relevant. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'assembly study': The object may be relevant for an assembly study;
'digital mock-up': The object may be relevant for digital mock-up;
'electrical design': The object may be relevant for the electrical design;
'mechanical design': The object may be relevant for the mechanical design;
'preliminary design': The object may be relevant for the preliminary design;
'process planning': The object may be relevant for the process planning;
'product support': The object may be relevant for the product support;
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any application domain.
the general stage in the product life cycle to which the concerned items belong. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'design': The concerned item belongs to the design phase of the life cycle;
'manufacturing': The concerned item belongs to the manufacturing phase of the life cycle;
'support': The concerned item belongs to the support phase of the life cycle;
'recycling': The concerned item belongs to the recycling phase of the life cycle;
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any life cycle stage.
The combination of the applicationDomain and the lifeCycleStage shall be unique.
A WorkOrder is an authorization for one or more objects to be performed.
One or more means that it is controlling the main activity and any sub-activity related to the activity by with of 'decomposition'.
the identifier or set of identifiers for the WorkOrder.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the WorkOrder.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification or set of identifications of a particular version of the WorkOrder.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions
the classifications of the WorkOrder.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the orderType specifies the kind of the WorkOrder. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'design deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved design data;
'design release': An authorization for the design of a product or of an item or to create a bill of material;
'management resolution': An authorization by a committee, such as the board of directors, to design or change an item;
'manufacturing release': An authorization for the manufacturing process of a product or of an item;
'production deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved manufacturing process.
one or many instances of that define the expected . The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the objects that are controlled by this particular WorkOrder
A WorkRequest is a solicitation for some work to be done.
These requests may not be acted upon depending on the authorization granted to the request or its associated .
the identifier or set of identifiers for the WorkRequest.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the WorkRequest.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification or set of identifications of a particular version of the WorkRequest.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
This attribute supports multi identification in different contexts as described in Fundamental concepts and assumptions
the classifications of the WorkRequest.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the intention of the WorkRequest. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'change of standard': A request to translate a change to a standard into action;
'cost reduction': A request aimed at reducing the engineering and manufacturing costs of an item;
'customer rejection': A request resulting from a rejection by a customer;
'customer request': A request for an activity that is necessary to solve the request of a customer;
'durability improvement': A request aimed at extending the life time of an item;
'government regulation': A request resulting from legal requirements;
'procurement alignment': A request to adjust the purchasing process of different items;
'production alignment': A request to adjust the manufacturing process of different items;
'production relief': A request aimed at achieving a simpler assembly and production process;
'production requirement': A request for an activity that is necessary from a production point of view;
'quality improvement': A request aimed at increasing the quality of an item;
'security reason': A request for an activity that is necessary from a security point of view;
'standardization': A request to unify variants of an item;
'supplier request': A request for an activity necessary to solve the request of a supplier;
'technical improvement': A request aimed at improving the technical aspects of an item;
'tool improvement': A request aimed at increasing the useful life of a tool.
the personnel that shall be informed about the WorkRequest and the date when the personnel or organization shall be informed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the person or organization who issued the WorkRequest and the date when this person or organization issued the WorkRequest.
the objects that are subject to the WorkRequest. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the study and resolution of the WorkRequest. The designations 'drafted', 'issued', 'deferred', 'proposed', 'in-work', 'completed', 'resolved', 'cancelled', and 'rejected' are examples of request status.
A WorkRequestRelationship is a relationship between two objects.
the text or the set of texts that provide further information about the WorkRequestRelationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the classifications of the WorkRequestRelationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'dependency': The related is dependent on the relating .
one object of that is part of the relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relationType.
the other object of that is part of the relationship.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relationType.
the related and the relating must be different.
A ZonalBreakdown is a type of
that identifies a partitioning of a product into a set of objects that are classified to be zonal objects. A ZonalBreakdown is a view of the spatial distribution of a product by means of parent-child relationships. Not all aspects of the product need to be included in a ZonalBreakdown. A ZonalBreakdown provides a decomposition of an aircraft in terms of spaces or high-level conceptual parts, such as 'wing', which might further decompose into lower-level zones such as 'inner-wing' and 'outer wing'.
Parent-child relationships are represented by objects.
the inherited attribute . The value of breakdownType shall be 'zonal'.
A ZoneStructuralMakeup is a type of that describes the structural makeup of a particular zone, area, or point within a laminate. A ZoneStructuralMakeup may be either a and a , or a and a , or a or a or a .
Structural makeup information consists of: 1) the smear material properties based on one or more constituents that reside in that zone or point; 2) the percentage of the total thickness within a zone or point that each constituent type makes up; and 3) the ordered list of physical constituents based on position within a zone or point. These three pieces of structural makeup information can coexist in any order to describe a zone or point within a laminate.
A single ZoneStructuralMakeup could apply to the whole part. The would be the case for a homogeneous structural part or a simple laminate of constant thickness and material constituents.
specifies a role of the for the ZoneStructuralMakeup. The boundary specifies the shape of the ZoneStructuralMakeup as either a point, one or more unique list of curves, or a face. When the boundary is not defined for an instance of a ZoneStructuralMakeup, the ZoneStructuralMakeup applies to the whole part. Then would be the case for a homogeneous structural part.
A ZoneStructuralMakeupShapeRepresentation is the shape of a zone or area of a part.
The zone can be a point, a specific area, or the entire part. A ZoneStructuralMakeupShapeRepresentation may be either a or a .
